title: Rihanna shows off her bedazzled flask at the Grammys | Daily Mail Online
text: She's just being Riri: Despite the classic look, the eight-time Grammy Award winner had no qualms about drinking openly from her flask while trophies were handed out onstage Party time: Rihanna and her pal were in the mood for fun Stylist Mel Ottenberg adorned the queen of R&B with sparkling Chopard diamond earrings, matching watch, cuffs and ring, and David Webb Jewels rings. For footwear, Miss Fenty opted to wear custom mules made by Giuseppe Zanotti. Despite the classic look, the eight-time Grammy Award winner had no qualms about drinking openly from her flask while trophies were handed out onstage. Feelin' it: During performances, the Work songstress got up to dance happily, flask in hand Emotional: Adele's performance drew up emotions for the Caribbean beauty Why hi there! The singer meets Blue Ivy, whose leg can be seen on left What a skirt: The singer was dressed to impress in her huge gown During performances, the Work songstress got up to dance happily, flask in hand. Though Riri's poison of choice is still unknown, the reason behind her unabashed indulgence may be more transparent. Riri's Anti album fell short of winning Best R&B Performance, which was snagged up by Solange Knowles, and Best Urban Contemporary Album, which was awarded to Beyonce for Lemonade at Sunday's award show. Rihanna could still snag Record of the Year with Drake for their collaboration, Work. She is up against adele for Hello, Beyonce for Formation, Lukas Graham for 7 Years, and Twenty One Pilots for Stressed Out. Friends: Other than enjoying her own private party, Rihanna entertained herself by mingling with Carrie Underwood and Ed Sheeran Stunners: Rihanna and Carrie looked gorgeous as they posed together for photos Other than enjoying her own private party, Rihanna also entertained herself by mingling with Carrie Underwood and Ed Sheeran. She also got a chance to visit with Jay Z, Beyonce, and Blue Ivy. Red carpet time: The Barbadian singer knows how to make an entrance GRAMMY AWARDS 2017 WINNERS
